title: Designing for incremental loading
description: Incremental loading or delta loading refers to the process of loading smaller increments of data into a storage solutionâ€”for example, we could have daily data that is being loaded into a data lake or hourly data flowing into an extract, transform, load (ETL) pipeline, and so on. During data-ingestion scenarios, it is very common to do a bulk upload followed by scheduled incremental loads.
